segment.source: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Troubleshooting the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: This topic includes information that you can use to help troubleshoot general issues on the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: This topic includes information that you can use to help troubleshoot general issues on the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: Creating an SFTD File by Using the App-V Sequencer Increases the Version Number Unexpectedly
segment.target: Creating an SFTD File by Using the App-V Sequencer Increases the Version Number Unexpectedly

segment.source: The version number associated with an SFTD file increases unexpectedly.
segment.target: The version number associated with an SFTD file increases unexpectedly.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Use the command line to generate a new .sft file.
segment.target: Use the command line to generate a new .sft file.

segment.source: To create the .sft file by using the command line, enter the following at a command prompt:
segment.target: To create the .sft file by using the command line, enter the following at a command prompt:

segment.source: mkdiffpkg.exe base SFT file namediff SFT file name
segment.target: mkdiffpkg.exe base SFT file namediff SFT file name

segment.source: File Name in OSD File Is Not Correct After Package Upgrade
segment.target: File Name in OSD File Is Not Correct After Package Upgrade

segment.source: After you upgrade an existing package, the file name is not correct.
segment.target: After you upgrade an existing package, the file name is not correct.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: When you open a package for upgrade, you should specify the root Q: drive as the output location for the package.
segment.target: When you open a package for upgrade, you should specify the root Q: drive as the output location for the package.

segment.source: Do not specify an associated file name with the output location.
segment.target: Do not specify an associated file name with the output location.

segment.source: Microsoft Word 2003 Default Install Results in an Error When Streamed to a Client
segment.target: Microsoft Word 2003 Default Install Results in an Error When Streamed to a Client

segment.source: When you stream Microsoft Word 2003 to a client, an error is returned but Microsoft Word continues to run.
segment.target: When you stream Microsoft Word 2003 to a client, an error is returned but Microsoft Word continues to run.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Resequence the virtual application package, and select Full Install.
segment.target: Resequence the virtual application package, and select Full Install.

segment.source: Package Upgrade Does Not Work When You Create a Dependent Package
segment.target: Package Upgrade Does Not Work When You Create a Dependent Package

segment.source: When you create a dependent package by using package upgrade and add new registry entries, it appears to function correctly but the updated registry entries are not available.
segment.target: When you create a dependent package by using package upgrade and add new registry entries, it appears to function correctly but the updated registry entries are not available.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Registry settings are always stored with the original version of the package, so updates to the package will not appear to be available unless you repair the original package.
segment.target: Registry settings are always stored with the original version of the package, so updates to the package will not appear to be available unless you repair the original package.

segment.source: Error When Trying to Sequence .NET 2.0
segment.target: Error When Trying to Sequence .NET 2.0

segment.source: When you sequence a package that requires .NET 2.0, you get an error.
segment.target: When you sequence a package that requires .NET 2.0, you get an error.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Sequencing packages that require .NET 2.0 is not supported.
segment.target: Sequencing packages that require .NET 2.0 is not supported.

segment.target: Related topics
